notes: As everyone gets free Dana, Mars will only replace her for World Boss, where she's better due to her being able to shield all 20 childs, instead of just 5. One of the best defensive options for World Boss.

Secret Heal acts as the healing version of the poison debuff. Has potential at higher uncaps to completely mitigate enemy damage in PvP. Recovery block isn't prevalent, making her not too useful at low uncaps.

jp_name: コレクター エルメス

notes: Bonus damage portion does not scale with buffs unless specified otherwise. Skill Queue: Slide (8s CD)

jp_name: レッドスター ヘラ
放浪者 パンテオン
notes: Great crit rate/crit damage buffer for all content. Best piloted manually as AI tend to tap him on auto. Pairs well with an attacker with multiple hits on their tap or slide for tremendous burst damage. A +0 Pantheon is roughly equal to a +3 Melpomene, the 4-star counterpart (+4 Pantheon would beat +6 Melpomene). Replaced by Lupin (+6 Pantheon is worse than a +0 Lupin).

Aria can help reach 3rd fever in World Boss at high uncaps, but generally, fever damage in World Boss isn't amazing unless you have Attack Stance buff (only 5 highest attack childs of the element attack during fever)

jp_name: 白炎の ヘスティア
notes: Hestia, unfortunately, is outperformed by other childs in every single mode. For PvP, Jupiter's bleed is stronger and scales better, where a +5 Jupiter has a stronger bleed than +6 Hestia. For Ragna and World Boss, her 2 hit slide and a weaker bleed that can be resisted means she underperforms even at very high uncaps compared to other attackers such as Morgan and Medb. Do not invest in her if possible.

jp_name: 呪われた人形 フレイ
notes: Has higher attack scaling on his slide compared to other dark attackers, meaning attack buffs will have greater impact in World Boss.

Metis's drive skill provides a large attack boost, which works well with Fever. 
Her skillset also allows you to survive the enemy's fever in PvP, with either Immortality or Berserk. If her Berserk buff is removed in any way, such as through Lan Fei's drive, then the stun will immediately trigger. Requires manual play to make full use of her kit. Tap scales to 2323 damage and 1118 HP heal at +6. Slide scales to 4%+107 HP regen at +6.

Works great in teams that aim to stall the enemy and reach fever time first. Relatively weak at low uncaps, but becomes very strong at high uncaps due to the scaling on her slide. Not effective for Ragna Break. For World Boss, she can help prevent the frequency that boss uses their drive skills, increasing survivability for your frontline. Pairs well with Isolde thanks to their shared targeting.

Very strong leader ability for Dark World Boss. Tap is also useful in World Boss for removing buffs. Confuse can steal the boss's buffs, but it will be very unreliable in Ragna due to the high resist; in World Boss, this can be alleviated thanks to other childs' Debuff Evasion debuffs. In PvP, Confuse will temporarily turn the fight into a pseudo 6v4. Weaker version of Limos for PvP.

jp_name: 無名の セイレーン
notes: A great option against Light element Aurora Kings to protect against reflect. Skill Queue: Tap (Standard); Slide (For % Damage in World Boss alongside Ignited Light Sytry). Ignition Priority: Low. She doesn't benefit much from Ignition compared to Daphnis, who gets 2 extra hits on slide.

One of the best water attackers for Fire Ragna and Fire World Boss thanks to Skill Queue. Tap scales to 2514 damage at +6. Slide scales to 4284 damage, 1344 Poison, and 556 Bonus damage at +6. Skill Queue: Tap.

jp_name: 純粋な シュリンクス
notes: Fortitude stacks can block single instances of damage, including DoTs such as poison, bleed, and dancing blade. Works best at countering small instances of high damage, but weak against DoT effects that can shred through fortitude quickly.

jp_name: レイシアフォーム イブ
notes: Currently has the highest poison damage in the game. Poison deals 100% damage whenever the target acts (autoattack, tap, slide, or drive), and deals 30% of poison damage when they receive an attack. As opposed to your own AI, the enemy AI won't prioritize non-poisoned childs when fevering, which can result in your enemy killing themselves through fever if they're poisoned. Fully ignited Eve has 6-hit slide, making her one of the best water attackers for all content.
Blind doesn't affect the debuff hit rate, as that's calculated separately from attack accuracy. Blind helps with survival against Dark Ragna Break Bosses and Dark World Bosses.

Percent based healing means you should prioritize HP gear on your child. Uncaps, evolution, regular and spa levels for your team help make Rusalka more effective. Immortality can tank enemy's fever in PvP. Tap scales to 995 HP heal at +6. Slide scales to 5.2%+107 HP regen at +6.

Epona can be used as a pseudo-tank if you manipulate her attack to be 2nd highest in the team, allowing Chang'e to speed her up for more shield and vampirism uptime. During Ragna, she can keep your whole team healthy by herself if you play manually. However, this won't be the case on auto, as AI loves to use her tap instead of her slide.

jp_name: 女帝 エリザベート
notes: Strong DPS option for Ragna due to her 4-hit tap and scaling 3-hit slide. The percentage in brackets for her slide means that additional attack stats will benefit her slide x% more than other attackers without any percentage.
Good drive for World Boss, but easily replaced by one of the other World Boss staples. At higher uncaps, she's great in a PvP team that tries to stall the enemy team and reach fever first.

One of the best general-use speed buffer. Her 2 second cool down for slide is significant, and 2 turns duration means it will on average last longer than any other time-based speed buffer. Gradually replaced by element-specific speed buffers for Ragna and World Boss. Ignition priority: Low. After Ignition, she speed buffs 3 targets, but still lacks additional utility in damage or sustain for Ragna/World Boss, as her speed buff overlaps with that of element specific buffers.

She should be categorized as a damage buffer rather than a tank, as she doesn't do much tanking and can actually make your childs take more damage. Amazing in Wood Ragna as well as all Wood World Boss. Her damage buff allows your fire DPS to keep up with the other elementally advantaged attackers in World Boss, which means you can recycle the Daoine squad instead of investing in additional attackers for that element. However, note that running Daoine Sidhe and fire attackers will steal buffs away from your other counter element attackers for World Boss, making weak point attacks less effective. With a high uncap Newbie Mona on your World Boss team, it's not recommended to run Daoine Sidhe for non-Wood World Bosses.
An offense based tank that utlizes reflect to deal damage back.

jp_name: 守護者 レッドクロス
notes: Works well in a fever stall PvP team that can make Red Cross unkillable either through healing (High uncap Astraea), the Immortality buff that prevents his HP from going below 1, or the Berserk buff that prevents all damage. Pairs best with Midnight Partners carta.

jp_name: ディーラー エシュ
notes: HoR Exclusive child (You may only get copies of this child through House of Reincarnation). Has potential for use in PvP as a counter to direct damage team comps (such as Siren and Nicole). However, it's hard for her to compete against Dana's skill set that isn't limited to only Water, making her niche.

Defense buff gives significant damage reduction, making her one of the best options for PvE sustain when combined with her Barriers. However, for Ragna/World Boss, she drops off. For PvP, she's less powerful than other tanks that can taunt to protect squishy targets, but is still a good option. Ignition Priority: Lowest. Doesn't benefit much from Ignition for its cost.

jp_name: 制覇の ジュピター
notes: Phased out of PvP due to childs with better DoT kits and targetting. Percent-based defense down on his tap isn't optimal for World Boss, as they don't have high enough defense for it to scale well. Bleed requires high uncaps (at least +4) to work well.

Tap scales to 2528 damage and Weak Point DEF -27.3% at +6. Slide scales to 3875 damage, 906 Ignore DEF damage, and Weak Point DEF -41.8% at +6. Great for all World Boss. Replaced by Unignited Mercury for Fire World Boss, and for all World Boss if Mercury is Ignited at least to Level 8. Skill Queue: Slide. Ignition Priority: Low. Ignite Mercury instead.

Her debuff explosion is often a detriment, as having the debuff stick would be more beneficial than a one-time damage burst. Debuff duration increase is useful for World Boss, especially when paired with Navi's Debuff Evasion decrease debuff.

Priority: Confused will be on a random target unless paired with Nirrti, who confuses the enemy with highest attack. Requires speed buff for Dark World Boss due to AI prioritizing her tap first before sliding. Skill Queue: Slide (10s CD)

jp_name: 月夜の ワーウルフ
notes: She's very useful for Light Ragna and Light World Boss. Her uses are limited outside of those two events.
Mafdet is strong in PvP against teams relying on healing. However, she doesn't do very well against Syrinx's fortitude stacks and will need another attacker to finish off targets.

jp_name: 情報屋 ブラウニー
notes: Brownie requires you to have at least 2 other wood childs to take full advantage of her buff, which limits her teambuilding capabilities - however, in the right team, she can be strong.

jp_name: マジシャン アリル
欺瞞の クランプス

notes: Myrina Charge Rate buff does not stack with Chang'e. For Fire World Boss, Myrina works well if you're also running the Daoine package, since she can consistently buff your water attackers while the fire DPS get speed buffed. Leader ability very effective for Fire Ragna, giving a large damage boost to your water DPS.

jp_name: ナイルの女王 クレオパトラ
notes: Great against Dark Raids where her Focus buff will allow you to deal critical damage during fever. Her Curse in PvP can do a lot of damage even when cleansed. In World Boss she requires a speed buff as AI will make her continually tap to get Focus otherwise. Like Jupiter's Bleed, her Curse gets much better at high uncaps. Falls behind Bridal Hildr on auto for Dark Ragna due to her Focus being percent based and having only a 2-hit slide.

One of the best 2 general-use speed buffer. Alternative to Chang'e, but they can also work together on the same team due to different priority and Thisbe's slide giving flat skill gauge amount, while Chang'e's slide gives a skill gauge charge amount buff (Thisbe's tap won't stack with other skill gauge amount speed buffs). The cooldown portion of her slide is applied before the gauge increase portion. Tap scales to 2538 damage and Skill Gauge Charge Amount +64.5% at +6. Slide scales to 3983 damage and Skill Gauge +66.1%. Skill Queue: Slide.

jp_name: ロイヤルキーパー モーガン
notes: Filler fire attacker for World Boss. Can be used for all non-water World Boss in a fire squad that includes Daoine Sidhe if you're lacking in counter-element attackers.

jp_name: 渇望の ヴェルデレト
notes: Good for Wood World Boss, especially when paired with a bleed child such as Morgan or Jupiter. Seen some use in PvP with a bleed focused team before Bathory, but has little place in the current meta with Bathory around.

jp_name: 幻影の デュランダル
notes: High variance in PvP if you don't run dark attackers, but his slide can potentially speed up your entire team. Leader for PvP would be good if Bathory didn't exist. Great for all World Boss, as even outside of Light World Boss, you can run a dark squad consisting of Durandal, Werewolf, and several dark attackers to help fill out your team and potentially replace your weak filler attackers.

jp_name: 人間界の ブリジット
notes: Only affecting fire childs make her restrictive in teambuilding. Slide is lackluster due to the restriction and being reliant on taking damage for a larger defense buff. Drive may be useful for Wood World Boss, but also requires your team to be low health for the greatest effect, which is unreliable. Anti-Barrier on tap doesn't provide enough value to justify using her in PvP.

Anti-barrier is too niche to be useful for PvE, and relies on barrier being present in PvP to be useful. Increased debuff duration is a tiny increase in overall damage, but can be useful in World Boss.

jp_name: ブラッディ バートリー
notes: Great for fighting against teams with DoTs. Defense debuff on slide can allow childs such as Jupiter target the same enemies. Both the DoT and the DEF - 20% part of Dancing Blade can stack. Great for Level 4 Rebirth Labyrinth as well.

jp_name: ガンスリンガー ヒルド
notes: HoR Exclusive child (You may only get copies of this child through House of Reincarnation). AI will tap first before sliding, making her often hit very hard in PvP. 4-hit slide ensures she is great for Dark Ragna and World Boss as well. Crit fever and taunt/reflect ignore is amazing for PvP.

Great against teams in PvP running healers, especially burst healers such as Neptune. Her death heal also works well for level 4 Rebirth Labyrinth, preventing Aurora's healing and bypassing Diablo's taunt.
Tap scales to 3030 damage, 60.9% CRT rate, and Debuff ACC +30.1% at +6. Slide scales to 4623 damage, 630 Ignore DEF damage, and 12047 Bonus damage at +6.
Great fire attacker for Wood World Bosses, but mediocre in all other modes.

Better than Lan Fei in PvP for teams that aim to stall and reach fever first. Targeting isn't as consistent due to not many teams running 2 healers, resulting in 1 or both of the hits landing on random targets. Strong leader ability for Fire World Boss. Drive reduction in slide is useful for helping your team survive. Tap scales to 2570 damage and 95.1% chance at +6. Slide scales to 3986 damage, Skill Gauge Charge Amount -52.1%, and Enemy Drive Gauge -19.8% at +6. Skill Queue: Slide.
Tap scales to 3012 damage and 95.6% chance at +6. Slide scales to 4459 damage, 1905 Ignore DEF damage, and x195 DoT at +6.
Good option to counter Poison damage.

Amazing for all Ragna/World Boss, but can be replaced in Ragna by other damage buffers. Vampirism on her tap is only applied if she cleanses a DoT debuff. Ignition Priority: Medium-Low. The 3 targets after Ignition is mostly only relevant for World Boss for those running 3 attackers (preferably Ignited).

jp_name: サマースパイク イゾルデ
notes: Water Balloon's damage is pure damage (will hit for the amount said on the skill). Freeze increases DoT damage by around 15%. Chance to apply debuff for her slide isn't tied to skill level, so low uncaps can also work. Higher uncaps will increase damage and her slow effectiveness. Tap scales to 2547 damage and 82.8% chance at +6. Slide scales to 3936 damage, -42.8% Skill Gauge Charge Speed, and 1300 damage for Water Balloon at +6. Can be useful for surviving against World Bosses with hard-hitting abilities

Gauge reduction portion of her slide relies heavily on RNG to get good value. Time Alteration is especially good at countering any speed buffer on the enemy team. Requires high uncaps for more reliable Time Alteration application chances due to the low base rate.

jp_name: ピュアスマイル ネプチューン
notes: The best support for all Ragna. She does it all: healing, speed buffing, and attack buffing. Her speed buff can stack with those that increase skill gauge amount such as Chang'e. Ideally, she fills your healer slot for Ragna. Life Link on her drive can negate at least 50% of fever damage, allowing your team to easily survive through the fever. Tap scales to 2523 damage and +52.1% heal amount at +6. Slide scales to 3940 damage, 64.5% Skill Gauge Charge Speed, and 75.2% Double-Edged Sword at +6. Ignition Priority: Low. The 3 target healing and speed buff is low impact if your team can already be sustained.
5 star version of 4 star dark attacker, Artemis. Her slide will allow her to deal significant damage to light childs in PvP at high uncaps.

jp_name: 研修生 ヴィーナス
notes: Can work in a fever stall comp that aims to tank the enemy fever through immortality and then fevering back for the win.

Her slide gains extra true damage for each buff and allows for massive damage in PvP. Scales to 700 damage per buff (up to 8) when maxed at +6. Additional damage for slide only applies once if there's a single target. Additional damage is treated as a debuff and can also be resisted naturally or with debuff immunity such as Dana's tap. Set skill reserve to tap for Ragna/World Boss, and slide for every other content.

Has one of the longer attacker cooldowns at 9 seconds. Great at targeting the enemy's water DPS and sniping them with the help of another DPS. With the shift of PvP meta to more debuffers and fewer attackers, Guardian Chang'e suffers from having fewer targets. Skill Queue: Slide (9s CD)

Niche PvP attacker who's great at destroying barriers, but lacks enough damage to finish off targets by herself. Best paired up with other large sources of damage to take advantage of her barrier break. Great for Dark Ragna and World Boss due to her 3-hit tap.  Skill Queue: Tap.
Limited child who was only available during the Miku collab. Newbie Mona replaces her, resulting in her being permanently benched.

Limited child who was only available during the Miku collab. Snow Miku helped a lot in Ragna Season 1, but her very limited skillset doesn't provide much room for her to function outside of that Ragna.
Tap scales to 2573 damage at +6. Slide scales to 3301 damage, 880 Ignore DEF damage, and 90.1% chance at +6. Highest 4-hit tap damage in the game. Skill Queue: Tap

jp_name: スウィート シトリー
notes: Staple for all World Boss.

jp_name: ダークバスター リザ

notes: Great for Fire Ragna due to her leader ability, bonus damage to fire on tap, and strong 3-hit slide. Best paired with Pantheon and Moment of Respite carta for Fire Ragna to maximize her slide crit damage.

Venom deals 904 damage at +6. Although the duration of Venom can't be cut or extended, it can still be cleansed childs like by Erato, Bast and Newbie Mona. Bathory's leader helps counter Demeter's Venom. Venom doesn't stack with itself.
Skill Queue: Tap
Limited child who was only available during the Catherine collab. Leader ability is good in Fire Ragna for more survivability.

jp_name: ピュアホワイト ポモナ
notes: Debuff cleanse is invaluable for any content with annoying debuffs such as Rebirth Labyrinth, PvP, or certain Ragna Break/World Bosses. Not ideal for Ragna Break as she lacks damage/speed buffs. For World Bosses, she's most valuable when she can solo heal, but if your lineup isn't tanky enough, this won't be enough as sustain, and can only be used to supplement your main healing. Ignition Priority: Low. The extra target after Ignition isn't high impact, as she doesn't increase damage if you can already survive beforehand.
Tap scales to 2569 damage and DEF -1318 at +6. Slide scales to 3969 damage, DEF -15.4% and 487 DoT at +6. Staple for all World Boss. Skill Queue: Slide.

One of the best fire attackers available. With her high-damage 4-hit slide, she's great in all game modes. AI will tap first to get her Battlecry buff for PvP, opening a window where you can disable Courtesan Bathory, let her Battlecry buff drop, and have AI tap her once again. Counters Fortitude with her tap. Skill Queue: Slide (9s CD)

Reflect on her slide scales up to 40% at maxed +6 skills, allowing her to take 40% less damage from attacks, while reflecting this portion back at the enemy. She has a unique tap that can redirect debuffs toward herself, where it can have less effect (unless the debuff says its duration can't be cut) or be resisted entirely. Leader ability makes your entire PvP team tanky with 3500 additional health for each child. Her kit makes her very strong for PvP in the current meta.

jp_name: ゼラニウム かすみ
notes: Limited child who was only available during the Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation collab.

jp_name: 異端児 ガネーシャ
notes: Drive is best set to 3rd for World Boss to take advantage of Offensive Stance. Include at least 5 fire childs with their tap ability invested, as fever hits takes tap damage into account.

jp_name: セクシーサンタ レダ

notes: Limited child who was only available during the Catherine collab.
Limited child who was only available during the Catherine collab.

A healer that can also deal decent damage for PvP. For PvP, Death Heal works well against comps with healers, especially those with Neptune. His healing at +6 maxed skill applies 407 hp regen and 406 flat healing (times number of buffs + 1) and deals 3643 damage with a max of 605 (time number of debuffs + 1) damage for Poetic Justice. Hybrid healer with damage potential for PvP to focus down and kill debuffed enemy childs.

jp_name: ピュアブライド ヒルド
notes: Top tier light attacker for Dark Ragna due to her guaranteed Focus for crit fever, and her 3-hit slide. Tap scales to 3045 damage and 755 Bonus damage at +6. Slide scales to 4636 damage, 1254 Ignore DEF damage and 2008 Bonus damage at +6.

Good for World Boss for her debuff evasion decrease and buff removal. Damage resonance has potential to do massive amounts of damage at high uncaps with hard-hitting childs such as Courtesan Bathory and Hildr. Tap scales to 2569 damage and -27.5% debuff EVA at +6. Slide scales to 3972 damage, 40% Damage Resonance, and 90.1% chance at +6.

A slightly improved Medb for light. Great in Dark Ragna and Dark World Boss due to the quad hit slide. Tap scales to 3317 damage and 680 Ignore DEF damage at +6. Slide scales to 4598 damage, and 530 Ignore DEF damage (756 Bonus damage for Raids only) at +6.
Upgraded version of 4 star cleansers, Erato and Bast. Immortal on her drive can counter enemy fever if timed correctly.

jp_name: デスマーチ オハド
notes: AI will prioritize tap first to gain Vampirism, making her suboptimal for World Boss. Tap scales to 3012 damage and 22.6% HP at +6. Slide scales to 4531 damage, 1905 Ignore DEF damage, and x195 DoT at +6. Skill Queue: Slide (8s CD).

jp_name: ロシアンブルー マリー・ローズ
notes: Limited child who was only available during the Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation collab.

jp_name: デルフィニウム ほのか
notes: Limited child who was only available during the Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation collab. One of the current best options for Wood Ragna due to her leader ability. Her healing can get a large increase from Daoine Sidhe's double edge buff.

jp_name: パーティスター メブ
ピンクブレザー イブ
notes: Uncaps significantly increases her chance to stun to 82.8% base at maxed +6, making more copies important if you plan to use her in PvP. Best paired with childs that can target those she stuns to increase the duration. Agility debuff means that subsequent skills have a higher chance of damaging and that the affected childs will have a low chance of dealing direct skill damage. Works better in a meta with at least 2 debuffers on opposing team. World Bosses are immune to stun, but she can still be useful with her leader ability.

jp_name: 神楽の ワーウルフ
notes: Useful for all World Boss due to her slide skill DEF down, which stacks with other DEF down effects for additional damage across your whole team.
Limited child who was only available during the Miku collab. Unfortunately, her skillset overlaps with Hatsune Miku and Pantheon, both of which are better choices for Ragna/World Boss.
Limited child who was only available during the Kemono Friends 2 collab.

Limited child who was only available during the Kemono Friends 2 collab. Global's skill translation is misleading for Serval. Her 3 hits for slide includes both the base damage and Ignore Def damage, making her significantly better than the description otherwise implies.

jp_name: しんりんの アライグマ
notes: Limited child who was only available during the Kemono Friends 2 collab.

jp_name: 第四魔道師団 ノエル
notes: Limited child who was only available during the BlazBlue collab.
Limited child who was only available during the BlazBlue collab.
Limited child who was only available during the BlazBlue collab.

jp_name: フィクサー ヘクトル
月光の アルテミス
危険な フォルトゥナ

notes: The 4 star speed buffer you run if you don't have Chang'e or Newbie Mona. Trap.
Normal damage, not bonus damage, skill description in game is wrong

Her regen scales well with uncaps, and as a support class, her slide skill cooldown is 7 compared to the healer cooldown of 9. This makes her very weak at lower uncaps, but one of the strongest healers in the game at high uncaps.
Selene provides a large amount of healing straight out of the box. She is the best entry healer and effective even without uncaps

jp_name: ハードボイルド 少女探偵
束縛の ベルセポネ
notes: High Ragna Boss debuff resistance combined with diminishing returns for her percentage-based weakness debuff makes Persephone a very mediocre option for Ragna.

jp_name: 乳母役の ネヴァン

notes: Ragna bosses have very high debuff resistance at level 40, making Freesia mediocre for Ragna. Good for World Boss as your defence break child until you have Bathory.

Even though her slide only mentions bleed and poison, Erato can remove other types of DoTs as well, unless they're specifically mentioned to be irremovable.
Requires high uncaps to function as a healer due to her low base healing. She fills a similar function as Bast, but does not do damage on her slide. This is actually preferable if you're running Moa in PvP, as you do not want the petrify stacks to wear off quickly.
Has use in World Boss as her gauge charge speed buff can stack with all other speed buffers' amount charge speed buff.

jp_name: 轟音の メルポメネ
notes:
A +6 Melpomeme is comparable to a +3/+4 Pantheon (depending on if you are using Melpomeme as leader). 
She pairs well with quad-hit tappers(childs with 4 hits on tap)for PvP for devastating single target burst damage.

jp_name: 悲しみの ソネット
notes: Sonnet still has decent poison scaling in global, but isn't as strong as she was in JP
Only good when you have a mostly water team, which makes him limited in team building.

jp_name: 束縛の イシュタル

notes:
Elysion requires multiple uncaps before she starts to shine, but as a four star, she should be far easy to acquire copies than her five star peers. 
Elysion has been significantly nerfed in global compared to JP

jp_name: 最後の アガメムノン
決戦の ティタニア
notes: Normal Damage, not bonus damage. Skill description is wrong
Yuna has decent slide attack spread, and is a fine alternative in ragna (especially season 0) when uncapped.
Merlin provides a large amount of healing straight out of the box. In general Selene is better as she heals 3 targets vrs 2

jp_name: 黄金の エルドラド
招かれざる客 ルドルフ

notes: Barriers don't stack, so at many times her barrier is useless

jp_name: 電光の アルゲース
若獅子 ヘラクレス

notes: Doesn't overwrite your poison during World Boss due to the ability being on tap, which has less priority than slide for poison application.
Removes all DoTs instead of just the 3 mentioned.

jp_name: 沈黙の アンノウン
ロンリー トリスタン
サマーキャンプ リザ
目覚めた キンティア
高慢な ムネモシネ
遵法の シャマシュ
復讐の メーデイア
歓声の バフォメット
あなたの サルマキス
孤高の ヴァルキリー
夢想家 ヒュプノス
熱い フェニックス
深淵の ティアマト
再生の ヴァルカン
名助手 アタランテ
下級ニンフ レウケ

notes: Can tank an entire fever with a well-timed slide. Taunt on tap means you can keep the ability activated nearly all the time due to the short cooldown. Enrage can retaliate with stored damage up to the listed skill damage multiplied by the listed percentage, after which the stored damage falls back to zero.

Reflect also reduces physical damage taken by that percentage (25% reflect reduces physical damage by 25%). Great at countering direct damage teams in PvP. Best paired with Dana, as solo tank Hades is squishy.
Tap scales to 2573 damage at +6. Slide scales to 4374 damage and 558 Absorb at +6. Slightly higher damage on tap than Siren, but has worse survivability. Skill Queue: Tap.
Prevalence of silence resist carta makes Olga less effective for PvP. Gets outclassed by the consistency and power of other newer debuffers
Her slide provides consistent CC to the same two highest attack enemies, but does not reset their skill gauge. Great with stall or DoT teams, as DoT doesn't take off petrify stacks.

Awkward skill set where she doesn't have damage mitigation along with her taunt, making her likely to die from the focus fire. Reflect on tap doesn't last long enough to take advantage of it through her taunt. Becomes great in PvP after Ignition.

Debuff EVA (evasion) decrease and duration increase combined with her weakpoint DEF debuff that stacks with that of Wood Midas makes her a staple World Boss debuffer. Tap scales to 2583 damage, Weak Point DEF -30.3% at +6. Slide scales to 3998 damage, Debuff EVA -27.5%, Debuff Duration +46.6%, and Weak Point DEF -5% at +6.

Weaker poison than Eve, but hits 3 targets. She's better than Eve for PvP, but weaker for World Boss. Tap scales to 2992 damage at +6. Slide scales to 4592 damage, 1612 Ignore DEF damage, and 1344 Poison.

Max HP increase acts as a heal, and can be prevented with Death Heal and Recovery Block. Frenzy on drive enables large fever damage during Ragna, and fever stall strategies for PvP. Tap scales to 2518 Damage and 90.1% chance at +6. Slide scales to 3936 Damage, Max HP +2360, 90.1% chance, and ATK +45.4% at +6.

HoR Exclusive child (You may only get copies of this child through House of Reincarnation). Powerful buff removal and slow for PvP and World Boss. Allure is very useful in preventing annoying self buffs from some World Bosses. Tap scales to 2583 damage and Skill Gauge -60.4% at +6. Slide scales to 3988 damage, Skill Gauge Charge Speed -60.4%, and 90.1% chance for both Allure and buff removal in PvP.
Not Released.

Tap scales to 3012 damage, 1032 Ignore DEF damage, 855 Bonus Damage, and 85.2% chance at to grant Overload +6. The best attacker currently released for Wood Ragna, and is particularly effective for the Piercing Luin Ragna. Good for Wood World Boss as well.

Tap scales to 2583 damage and 59.7% attack ACC decrease at +6. Slide scales to 3997 damage, 67.8% attack ACC decrease, and 40.1% debuff ACC decrease at +6. Her Blind debuffs attack and debuff accuracy at the same time, greatly lessening the impact of enemy debuffers. It's also very useful for World Boss at increasing your survivability.

Tap scales to 2538 damage and 1508 HP barrier at +6. Slide scales to 3983 damage, +74.5% Charge Amount, +50.4% Weak Point Skill Final Blow, and 34% Vampirism at +6. Her Vampirism ability will be vital in helping your team survive against the Ragna boss's reflect and death heal. Replaces Chang'e for Altered Davi Ragna, as her speed buff won't stack with that of Chang'e.

Ability to confuse 2 childs is really powerful in PvP, as it makes the fight temporarily into a pseudo 7v3. With her targeting highest defense, before facing her, make sure to manipulate your team's stats so that her confuse will land on the least impactful childs, ideally both before and after the ATK-DEF switch. Drive gauge can still be gained as normal while confused. Tap scales to 2583 damage and 80.1% chance at +6. Slide scales to 3998 damage, and 90.2% chance for both debuffs at +6.

Watersnake deals +40% damage if there's weakpoint bonus for your water child (defender is fire), while it has -40% damage if enemy has weakpoint advantage (defender is wood); otherwise, it deals the listed skill damage. Tap scales to 2583 damage and -60.4% at +6. Slide scales to 3997 damage, 1056 Ignore DEF damage, and 1605 for Watersnake at +6.

Tap scales to 3047 damage, 855 bonus damage and 21.4% Vampirism at +6. Slide deals 4666 damage, 1496 Ignore DEF damage, 1103 bonus damage, and 25209 Fixed damage at +6. The fixed damage portion only occurs once upon critical hit.
Tap scales to 2183 damage and DEF +46.6% at +6. Slide scales to 3543 damage, 90.1% chance and 2560 HP barrier at +6. Disable Debuffs include Petrify, Silence, Confuse, Stun, Sleep, and Smite.

Tap scales to 2570 damage and 85.1% chance at +6. Slide scales to 3986 damage, 1056 Ignore DEF damage, and 801 Bleed at +6. Slightly stronger than Jupiter. Newbie bait, be wary of investing. Not much use outside of PvP as a bleed applier, but quickly gets replaced by Ignited attackers

Tap scales to 3060 damage, 95.6% chance for Recovery Block, and 90.1% chance for Awakening at +6. Slide scales to 4675 damage and 1505 Ignore DEF damage. Very strong leader ability for Fire World Boss. Skill Queue: Tap-Slide. Fully ignited Justice Mafdet has 6-hit slide, making her the hardest hitting water attacker for all content.

Tap scales to 2570 damage and ATK -25.4% at +6. Slide scales to 3986 damage, 60.1% chance to activate Taunt, and 92.8% chance to inflict Petrify at +6. Her chance to activate Taunt is unreliable even at +6. A single Petrify stack means that a random auto can break the status effect. Might have niche application in PvP to counter the enemy's fever if you place her in the middle where she can petrify the entire enemy team.

Tap scales to 2537 damage and 90.1% chance to remove Petrify at +6. Slide scales to 3965 damage, Skill Gauge Charge Speed +74.5%, and increase Weak Point Skill Final Blow by 5.4% at +6. Great for Dark World Boss, especially effective for the Medusa World Boss. Counts herself among the number of Light Type allies. Include a maximum of 5 Light attackers and a minimum of 10 Light Type allies to take advantage of her slide scaling.

Tap scales to 2538 damage and 85.6% chance at +6. Slide scales to 3983 damage, 110.2% Double-Edged Sword, Skill Gauge +40.1%, and Tap Skill damage +50.6% at +6. Very powerful damage buffer with ability to also speed up 2 fire allies. The targeting for her slide means that ideally 2 other fire allies besides Failnaught should be the highest attack to take advantage of the gauge increase. Leader is decent if you don't have Love & Hate Davi or Tragedy Rusalka.

Tap scales to 3045 damage and 92.8% chance at +6. Slide scales to 4636 damage, 120 DoT, and 803 Bonus damage at +6. PvP only attacker whom will be more useful once the mode with 15-child teams come out.

Limited child who was only available during the Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation collab rerun. Tap scales to 3060 damage and Skill Final Blow +50.4% at +6. Slide scales to 4678 damage, 1256 Ignore DEF damage, and 8500 damage for each buff at +6. Strong water attacker for Wood World Boss if among highest 2 attack for maximum buff scaling. Skill Queue: Slide.

Limited child who was only available during the Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation collab rerun. Tap scales to 2589 damage, ATK -30.9%, and 95.1% chance at +6. Slide scales to 4015 damage, Critical damage -50.6%, and DEF -45% at +6. World Boss usually don't have very high defense, making percentage DEF debuff not as good as flat DEF debuff. If a future World Boss does have high defense, she will be able to shine.

Tap scales to 2180 damage and grants 1187 HP Barrier at +6. Slide scales to 3527 damage and stores up to 502% of damage taken and DEF +51.6% to all Allies at +6. Has some uses for World Boss to improve survivability for your frontline on especially hard hitting bosses. No place in modes with only 5 team slots, as Dana is nearly always better.

Tap scales to 2584 damage and Skill Gauge -60.4% at +6. Slide scales to 4014 damage, Skill Gauge Charge Speed -65.4%, and Slide Skill Cooldown +2 seconds at +6. Strong PvP debuffer with a high base percentage chance for his skills, making him effective even at low uncaps. Targeting will be random if there are fewer than 2 water type enemies on the other team.

Tap scales to 2553 damage, Skill Gauge +40.8%, and 85.6% chance to remove Allure at +6. Slide scales to 4024 damage, and Skill Gauge Charge Amount +83% at +6. The speed buffer of choice for Attis Ragna, with a kit that counters the boss well. Slide buff lasts for a long time at 2 turns, leaving room to spam taps in between for additional skill gauge gains. Nullify Debuffs is very useful for PvP, provided that you build your team so that your fire childs will get targeted by enemy debuffs. Skill Queue: Slide - Tap - Tap.

Tap scales to 3060 damage, 460 DoT, and Skill Gauge Charge Amount +64.5% at +6. Slide scales to 4678 damage, 2303 Ignore DEF damage, and 2703 Bonus damage at +6. Strong DoT attacker for PvP, but requires very high uncaps due to the scaling for Curse. Self buff on tap means she doesn't need to be highest 2 attack and can avoid enemies that have such targeting. Curse can also stack with itself. Ignition Priority: Medium-Low. After Ignition, her speed buff works in other modes, making her a self-sufficient attacker for Dark World Boss. For PvP, her increased target for slide and Curse DoT damage makes her a very strong debuffer disguised as an attacker.

Tap scales to 3045 damage and increase AGL by 40% at +6. Slide scales to 4636 damage, 700 damage for each buff, and a factor of x701 at +6. Main strength comes from scaling damage based on amount of buffs, making uncaps more important for her. More useful for Wood World Boss than Wood Ragna as a 3-hit slider with additional damage. Skill Queue: Slide

Tap scales to 2538 damage and 90.1% chance at +6. Slide scales to 3983 damage, Skill Gauge Charge Amount +74.5%, ATK +45.4%, and Skill Damage +34.5% at +6. Replaces Chang'e for Fire World Boss, and can compete for a slot with her in Fire Ragna. Skill Queue: World Boss - Slide; Ragna - Slide Tap Tap

Tap scales to 3060 damage and Debuff EVA +37.3% at +6. Slide scales to 4678 damage, 1104 Ignore DEF damage, and 700 damage per buff at +6. Great PvP single target attacker - best paired with debuffers who lower defense such as Banshee.

Tap scales to 2552 damage, Skill Gauge +40.8%, and 75.2% chance at +6. Slide scales to 4007 damage, Skill Gauge Charge Speed +74.5%, Weak Point Skill Final Blow +60.3%, and +2249 Barrier at +6. Great speed/damage buffer for Fire Ragna/World Boss, with the currently best drive for Fire Ragna. Skill Queue: Slide - Tap - Tap

Tap scales to 2470 damage and Debuff ACC -20% at +6. Slide scales to 3986 damage, 82.8%  chance, and ATK -2562 at +6. Sleep is very strong for PvP, but the short duration makes it hard for AI to take advantage of the debuff. Manual play is recommended for her to be effective.

Tap scales to 3047 damage and 92.8% chance at +6. Slide scales to 4666 damage, 1498 Ignore DEF damage, and 2814 Bonus Damage at +6. Strong PvP fire attacker at high uncaps, but won't perform as well in a meta filled with many strong water childs. Guard buffs include DEF↑, Skill DEF↑, Immortality, Fortitude, Barrier, Taunt, Debuff Taunt, Max HP+, Pain Adaptation, and Ice Shield.

Tap scales to 2546 damage at +6. Slide scales to -52.8% duration and Skill Gauge Charge Speed +74.5% at +6. Speed buff will stack with [Skill Gauge Charge Amount] speed buffs given by childs like Chang'e. More useful in a PvP meta where the primary threats are debuffers, rather than hard-hitting attackers.
Tap scales to 2224 damage and DEF -1145 at +6. Slide scales to 3197 damage and 64.8% chance at +6.

Tap scales to 3068 damage, 1074 Ignore DEF damage, and Skill Damage +40.1% at +6. Slide scales to 4423 (187.2%) damage and 4105 Ignore DEF damage at +6. Skill Queue (World Boss): Slide (Unignited), Unassigned (Ignited)

Tap scales to 2552 damage and 85.6% chance at +6. Slide scales to 4009 damage, 115.2% Double-Edged Sword, and Drive Gauge +33 at +6. Staple for Dark World Boss with Double-Edge buff and Offensive Stance on drive (set her to 3rd drive).

Tap scales to 3068 damage and 1074 Bonus damage at +6. Slide scales to 4708 damage, 900 Bonus damage, and 600 Necrosis at +6. Weaker in a PvP meta where games are short and decided through direct damage rather than DoTs.

jp_name: がんばるキミのネプチューン
notes: Tap scales to 2206 damage and 90.1% chance at +6. Slide scales to 3597 damage, DEF +56.6%, Skill Gauge Charge Speed -50.4%, and 90.1% chance to nullify disable debuffs at +6. Disable Debuffs includes Petrify, Silence, Confuse, Stun, Sleep, and Smite. Good for PvP in protecting valuable Water childs against teams relying on Disable Debuffs such as Sleep and Confuse.

jp_name: 唯一無二の ヴィーナス
notes: Tap scales to 2565 damage and 82.5% chance at +6. Slide scales to 4035 damage, 78% Skill Gauge Charge Amount, and 90.1% chance for Time Twist and nullify DoT debuffs at +6. Strong speed buffer for a Wood-focused PvP team, which unfortunately has no place in the current meta. May change after the Wood element receives its ignition update. Upgrade over Brownie  for World Boss teams, allowing you to select your speed buff targets by manipulating their attack values.

Tap scales to 2205 damage and Max HP +1299 at +6. Slide scales to 3579 damage, DEF +51.6%, Skill Gauge Charge Speed -50.4%, and Max HP +2560 at +6. Requires at least 2 other water childs to make full use of her slide. Ice Shield won't consistently activate compared to Sparkling Neptune.

Tap scales to 2347 damage and 80.1% chance at +6. Slide scales to 3719, 4.3%+114 HP, and Debuff EVA +25.5% at +6. Debuff evasion limited to only Wood childs makes teambuilding very restrictive, as the best childs of each role usually aren't Wood type. May have use in Water World Boss to protect your frontline against debuffs.

Tap scales to 3060 damage and Slide Skill Final Blow +65.4% at +6. Slide scales to 4678 damage, 1216 Ignore DEF damage, 806 Bonus damage, and a factor of x1502 at +6.  Turn-based slide buff for 2 turns means that it will last a significant amount of the time compared to second-based buffs. Becomes much better after Ignition with a 6-hit slide. Guard buffs include DEF↑, Skill DEF↑, Immortality, Fortitude, Barrier, Taunt, Debuff Taunt, Max HP+, Pain Adaptation, and Ice Shield.

Tap scales to 3030 damage and 90.1% chance to nullify Guard buffs at +6. Slide scales to 4624 damage, 1603 Bonus damage, and 1644 Poison at +6. 3-hit slide and Poison makes her good for PvE, but better for PvP. Higher kill potential after Ignition with 4-hit slide. Guard buffs include DEF↑, Skill DEF↑, Immortality, Fortitude, Barrier, Taunt, Debuff Taunt, Max HP+, Pain Adaptation, and Ice Shield.

Tap scales to 2546 damage and Skill Gauge +40.8% at +6. Slide scales to 3988 damage, Slide Skill Damage +75.2%, Skill Gauge Charge Amount +83%, and 90.1% chance at +6. Great for Water Ragna, especially those with time-based buffs, with some uses for Water World Boss as a damage and speed buffer. Best paired with slide-based attackers, but can also work with tap-based attackers due to her tap. Skill Queue: Slide - Tap (When boss has time-based debuffs) Slide - Tap - Tap (When boss doesn't have time-based debuffs)

Tap scales to 2347 damage, +1508 Barrier, and +57.1% Regen Amount at +6. Slide scales to 3719 damage, 4.3%+114 HP Regen, and 90.1% chance at +6. Slide and Leader ability are useful in PvP against debuff focused teams, particularly those that use disable debuffs. Disable Debuffs includes Petrify, Silence, Confuse, Stun, Sleep, and Smite. Weaker against teams without disable debuffs or have high burst damage to go over the top of the heals. Good for Level 5 Labyrinth to counter the silences.

Tap scales to 2212 damage at +6. Slide scales to 3618 damage and 45% Reflect at +6. Great taunt defender for PvP, with reflect reducing damage taken by the amount reflected. Requires high uncaps to work well. Invincible duration is very short, making it unreliable for auto.

Tap scales to 3060 damage, 1032 Ignore DEF damage, 905 Bonus damage, and 102100 Bonus damage when you have a time-based buff. Slide scales to 4675 damage, 2303 Ignore DEF damage, and 90.1% chance at +6. Incredible tap-focused water attacker for fire Ragna Raids with massive bonus damage. Leader ability can stack with regular cooldown buffs, making slide-based attackers much more potent when run alongside. Bonus damage portion of skills aren't affected by additional stats and buffs unless specifically stated. Time-based buffs includes Skill charge amount, Skill charge speed, Time Twist, Debuff duration reduction, Drive gauge amount increase, and Slide cooldown reduction.

Tap scales to 2335 damage and +1558 Barrier at +6. Slide scales to 435 Regen and 50.5% Life Link at +6. Life Link also reduces damage taken by the stated amount. At higher uncaps, she can effectively negate the direct damage of all attackers with lowest HP targeting when her Life Link ability is active.

Tap scales to 3068 damage, 1074 Ignore DEF damage, and Skill damage +65.4% at +6. Slide scales to 4660 (197.2%) damage and 4105 Ignore DEF damage. Slide gains additional x% benefit from additional attack stats/buffs compared to attackers without % value.

Tap scales to 2584 damage and Drive Skill Damage DEF -58% at +6. Slide scales to 4014 damage, Skill Gauge -66.1%, and 1700 Snow Bomb damage at +6. Targeting is mediocre, with the second target being random if the enemy only has 1 defender. Unignited, his kit has a lot of RNG due to enemy skill gauge variance. Ignition makes him much stronger with additional target and slow, allowing the reset to get more value.

Tap scales to 3012 damage and 120% damage at +6. Slide scales to 4613 damage, x701 factor, and 1808 Bonus damage at +6. Very strong PvP attacker who can get rid of enemy guard buffs while dealing damage in the process. Full Ignition makes her even stronger by hitting an additional target twice on her slide, for a total of 6 hits, turning her into a powerhouse as well for Light Ragna and World Boss. Guard buffs include DEF↑, Skill DEF↑, Immortality, Fortitude, Barrier, Taunt, Debuff Taunt, Max HP+, Pain Adaptation, and Ice Shield.

Tap scales to 3030 damage, 1332 Ignore def damage, 1055 Bonus damage, and 51180 Magic damage at +6. Slide scales to 4708 damage and 2180 Magic damage at +6. Another overpowered tap-based attacker for Ragna. Her Magic damage on tap has a massive base value and low scaling, making uncaps and Ignition not as important for her. Skill Queue: Tap.

Tap scales to 2547 damage and 80.1% chance at +6. Slide scales to 4004 damage, 90.1% chance, Tap skill final blow +75.2%, and 34% Vampirism at +6. Great damage buffer for Ragna while also providing sustain through Vampirism, which bypasses Death Heal. Her Support and Tap skill buffs on slide only apply for Dark allies, prioritizing highest attack.

Tap scales to 2584 damage and +65.4% Debuff duration at +6. Slide scales to 4014 damage, 45% Damage Resonance, and 90.1% chance at +6. Tap is very useful for World Boss for higher debuff uptime. Highest HP targeting in PvP is awkward if Marked isn't applied at the same time. With many teams running a Taunt child and stacking debuff evasion through their equipment, Seth isn't as impactful.

Tap scales to 2347 damage, 80.1% chance, and 1468 HP Heal at +6. Slide scales to 3719 damage, 3527 HP Death Heal, and 3727 HP Heal at +6. Healer with a Death Heal gimmick that won't consistent activate due to her low activation chance.

Tap scales to 3062 damage, 1174 Ignore DEF damage, and ATK +35.1% at +6. Slide scales to 4532 (192.2%) damage and a factor of x 701 at +6. Slide gains additional attack from buffs and equipment according to the percentage inside the brackets, making her particularly good during World Boss.

Tap scales to 2195 damage at +6. Slide scales to 3570 damage, 95% chance, and Max HP +2560 at +6. Has potential in PvP in a wood-based team for extra sustain. Requires high uncaps for extra percentage chance to grant Immortal.

Tap scales to 2547 damage and 90.1% chance for both at +6. Slide scales to 4004 damage, CRT rate +70.1%, CRT damage +100%, and Slide Skill Final Blow +90.1% at +6. Better than +6 Pantheon at +0 due to her turn-based slide buff, Awakening on tap, and Offensive Stance on drive. Top tier for all Ragna and World Boss.

Tap scales to 3047 damage and 85.1% chance at +6. Slide scales to 4663 damage, 3405 Ignore DEF damage, and 12047 Bonus damage at +6. Slightly better in World Boss than Ragna due to her bonus damage on slide, but is still worse than light attackers with 4 hits on their slide.

Tap scales to 2547 damage, Skill Gauge +40.8% and 90.1% chance to nullify Petrify at +6. Slide scales to 4004 damage, 90.1% chance to grant Support/Aid and Time Twist respectively, and Skill Gauge +66.1% at +6.

Tap scales to 3060 damage and 905 Bonus damage at +6. Slide scales to 4675 damage, 1603 Bonus damage, and 87.8% chance at +6. Best against teams with important Light childs you want to snipe. Targeting will be random if there's no light, making her inconsistent in taking out opposing threats.

Tap scales to 2608 damage and Debuff EVA -19% at +6. Slide scales to 4052 damage, EVA -30.6%, ATK -40.9%, and Weak Point DEF -100.4% at +6. Better at +0 than Wood Midas at +6 for Fire World Boss. Requires at least level 8 Ignition to be used for other elements as well.

Tap scales to 2195 damage and EVA +23.1% at +6. Slide scales to 3574 damage, DEF +61.6%, and Barrier +1760 at +6. Decent option to protect against attackers in PvP, but having EVA buff on her tap is awkward when her taunt, DEF buff, and barrier are on her slide. Being Fire element also hurts when PvP has an abundance of Water childs.

Tap scales to 2547 damage, Skill Gauge +40.8%, and 95% chance at +6. Slide scales to 4004 damage, Skill Gauge Charge Amount +78%, and Weak Point Skill Final Blow +100% at +6. Staple dark speed buffer for all Light Ragna/World Boss. Skill gauge charge on tap works for all elements, allow teams to run her for all elements of World Boss. Skill Queue: Slide-Tap-Tap (Ragna); Slide-Tap-Tap-Tap-Tap (Ignited  Lv.5, in World Boss). Ignition Priority: Medium-Low. After Ignition, she gains slightly higher numbers for her buffs, and at Ignition level 5, the duration on slide changes into turns, allowing more taps in between her buff application for World Boss.

Tap scales to 2589 damage and Skill Gauge Charge Amount -42.1% at +6. Slide scales to 4015 damage, 1056 Ignore DEF damage and 540 DoT at +6. High base chance for Electrocution to land, with additional uncaps increasing Juno's skill damage, DoT, and skill gauge related effects. Random targeting isn't ideal due to not being able to prioritize high threat targets. Has potential for World Boss if Electrocution isn't disabled as a great damage mitigation tool.

Tap scales to 2167 damage and 17.6% Vampirism at +6. Slide scales to 3143 damage and EVA +40.6% at +6. Has potential to be annoying in Endless Duels with the EVA buff for 3 targets, especially after Ignition. Critical hits will counter EVA; Weakpoint damage will counter EVA as well, to a certain degree.

Tap scales to 2195 damage and +61.6% at +6. Slide scales to 3570 damage, 30% Reflect at +6. Great in PvP against direct damage, but not so much against DoTs (Damage over Time). Ignition Priority: Medium (PvP only). Only relevant in PvP, but after Ignition she gets significant upgrades in barrier and extra hit for Fortitude on slide, and Immortal on drive.

Tap scales to 3055 damage, 3125 Combo, and 92.8% chance at +6. Slide scales to 4628 damage, 1603 Bonus damage, and 3180 Fixed damage at +6. Decent single-target dark attacker for PvP to snipe high priority attackers. Weaker in higher leagues. Ignition Priority: Low. Extra hit after Ignition, but is low priority compared to Igniting 6-hit sliders.

Tap scales to 2233 damage and -19% at +6. Slide scales to 3205 damage and 537 Bleed at +6. Endless PvP only. AI won't be consistent with sliding. Ignition Priority: Medium-Low. Lower Ignition cost due to being a 4 star, and gets additional target and higher Bleed after Ignition. Potentially good for Endless PvP, but no use anywhere else.

Tap scales to 2550 damage and 80.1% chance at +6. Slide scales to 4003 damage, +2360 Max HP, and 125.2% Double-Edged Sword at +6. Great for Fire Ragna against Bosses with annoying debuffs. Not much use elsewhere. Ignition Priority: Low. Slightly higher Double-Edged Sword percentage after Ignition, nullify Allure on tap, and extra Nullify Debuff on drive, but is severely limited in the content she's used in.

Tap scales to 2590 damage and 603 Bleed at +6. Slide scales 4035 damage, 85.2% chance, and +40.6% debuff duration at +6. Great for both PvP with Allure and all World Boss as a debuff extender as well. Ignition Priority: Medium (for PvP);Low (for WB). Higher priority for PvP focus due to 3 targets for Allure. For World Boss, she only gets slightly higher debuff duration.
